about.title: What is MapMyRoots?
about.description: MapMyRoots is a free online family tree creation tool that helps you visualize and preserve your family history. Unlike expensive genealogy services, we focus on making family tree building simple, beautiful, and accessible to everyone.

drag_drop.title: Intuitive Drag & Drop Interface

interactive.title: Interactive Family Tree Canvas
interactive.description: Beautiful, responsive family trees with smooth animations, zoom controls, and multiple viewing modes. Works perfectly on desktop, tablet, and mobile devices.

profiles.description: Store comprehensive information for each family member including names, birth/death dates, relationships, photos, and personal notes. Build rich family histories.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about MapMyRoots family tree software

free.question: Is MapMyRoots completely free to use?
free.answer: Yes, MapMyRoots is completely free with no hidden costs, subscription fees, or premium tiers. You can create unlimited family trees and access all features forever. We believe family history preservation should be accessible to everyone.

compare.question: How does MapMyRoots compare to Ancestry.com or MyHeritage?
compare.answer: Unlike paid services like Ancestry.com ($24.99/month) or MyHeritage ($12.95/month), MapMyRoots is completely free and focuses on family tree visualization rather than genealogical research. You own your data and can export it anytime in multiple formats.

export.question: What file formats can I export my family tree in?
export.answer: You can export your family tree as high-resolution images (PNG, JPG), PDF documents perfect for printing, or JSON data for backup and sharing with other genealogy software. No restrictions or watermarks.

register.question: Do I need to register or create an account?
register.answer: No registration required! You can start building your family tree immediately. However, creating a free account lets you save your trees online and access them from any device.

mobile.question: Can I use MapMyRoots on mobile devices?
mobile.answer: Yes, MapMyRoots works perfectly on desktop computers, tablets, and mobile phones. The responsive design adapts to your screen size while maintaining full functionality.

limit.question: How many people can I add to my family tree?
limit.answer: There's no limit! You can add as many family members as you want and create multiple family trees. Users have successfully created trees with hundreds of family members.

cta.title: Start Building Your Family Tree Today
cta.description: Join over 15,000 families who have already discovered their heritage. Create your first family tree in minutes, completely free with no registration required.

line_removal.message: This will hide the visual connection line but preserve the relationship data. The family relationship will remain intact and can be restored later.

meta.title: Genealogy Glossary - Essential Terms for Family History Research | MapMyRoots
meta.description: Comprehensive glossary of genealogical terms and definitions. Learn essential vocabulary for family history research and family tree building with MapMyRoots.
meta.keywords: genealogy glossary, genealogical terms, family history vocabulary, ancestry definitions, genealogy dictionary, research terms

og.title: Genealogy Glossary - Essential Terms for Family History Research
og.description: Master genealogical vocabulary with our comprehensive glossary. Essential terms and definitions for successful family history research.

twitter.title: Genealogy Glossary - Essential Terms for Family History Research
twitter.description: Master genealogical vocabulary with our comprehensive glossary. Essential terms and definitions for successful family history research.

hero.title: Genealogy Glossary
hero.subtitle: Master the language of family history research with our comprehensive collection of genealogical terms and definitions.

search.no_results_text: Try searching for a different term or browse by letter above.

abstract.name: Abstract
abstract.definition: An abbreviated transcription of a document that includes the date of the record and every name it contains. May also provide relationships or descriptions of the people mentioned.

affinity.name: Affinity
affinity.definition: A relationship created by marriage. It refers to the connection between a person and their spouse's blood relatives, or between a person and their relative's spouse.

ahnentafel.name: Ahnentafel
ahnentafel.definition: A German word meaning "ancestor table." This numbering system assigns each ancestor a number, making organization easier. The subject is #1, father #2, mother #3, etc.

ancestor.name: Ancestor
ancestor.definition: A person from whom one is descended, typically more distant than grandparents. Includes parents, grandparents, great-grandparents, and earlier generations.

ancestry.name: Ancestry
ancestry.definition: One's family or ethnic descent; the line of people from whom a person is descended. Also refers to the collective ancestors of a family.

autosomal_dna.name: Autosomal DNA
autosomal_dna.definition: DNA inherited from both parents that can help identify relatives within about 5-7 generations. Used in modern DNA testing for genealogy.

banns.name: Banns
banns.definition: Public announcements of an intended marriage, traditionally made in church on three successive Sundays before the wedding ceremony.

birth_record.name: Birth Record
birth_record.definition: An official document recording the birth of a person, typically including name, date, place of birth, and parents' names.

brick_wall.name: Brick Wall
brick_wall.definition: A genealogical term for a research obstacle where no additional information can be found about an ancestor, creating a dead end in research.

census.name: Census
census.definition: An official count and survey of a population, typically including names, ages, occupations, and family relationships. Conducted periodically by governments.

family_tree.name: Family Tree
family_tree.definition: A chart showing family relationships in a tree structure, displaying ancestors, descendants, and collateral relatives.

genealogy.name: Genealogy
genealogy.definition: The study and tracing of family lineages and histories; the practice of researching and documenting family relationships.
